adrFormatAddress: 1103 1st Ave., New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: Take a leap of faith meat lovers and check out Quantum Leap. Menu is 90% vegetarian and vegan friendly with a small selection dedicated to fresh fish. A friend recommended this place, a loyal patron for many years so I knew I'd be in good hands. Mgr Jenny was warm and friendly the minute I arrived. I ordered the Grilled "chicken" (seitan not real chicken) satay with peanut and coconut sauce, very delicious. Totally enjoyed the black bean quesadilla with the surprisingly sweet salsa and fresh guac and chips. Portions were generous. Desserts are just as divine, even though we had our carrot walnut cake deconstructed, it was delicious on its own. Menu has a lot of variety. Elvin our waiter, was very attentive and never rushed us to order as we ordered one course at a time. Go early to beat the dinner rush and if you're in the hood for lunch, daily specials for $12! What a deal. Next time I'm trying that vegan Oreo shake, or the peanut butter one, or the pumpkin mousse...so many choices.

originalText.text:
Wow. My boyfriend and I randomly searched a vegan spot near by and found this. Quantum Leap did not disappoint! The host was lovely, the jazz music in the background created a speakeasy mood, and the food options were amazing.

We ordered the all day brunch special on a Thursday! I love brunch items and the food was delicious! 10/10 recommend this place.

text.text:

originalText.text: I don‘t usually post about anything but today I just had to. I‘ve been to Quantum Leap close to Washington Square Park about 10 years ago. It was my absolute favorite and I would tell everyone about it. So imagine my surprise when I came back to the city and it wasn‘t there anymore. So a quick search later I found this location. And safe to say I loved it just as much! The food was amazing and the staff super nice! Had a nice chat with one of them and she was just the cutest. Thanks for everything! 100% would and will recommend!

originalText.text:
Being in business for so many years is a testament of time of how wonderful this restaurant is.
I couldn’t been more impressed with everything Quantum Leap has to offer.
Starting with the comfortable atmosphere ,very friendly staff,Caroline  and most important, the food.
Sampled their soups, salads ,main entrees.  And please save room for their desserts
All good!  Cannot wait to go back again
Heard their All Day Vegan Pancakes are the best, which I’ll try next time.
Menu supports so many great choices
Thanks to Jenny for bringing us the Best Vegetarian & Fish restaurant ever.

originalText.text:
Pescatarian (mostly vegetarian and vegan) restaurant with a relatively small interior (7ish double tables). They have a few different cuisines on the menu but seem to be popular for the American food (burgers and wings). I got the quinoa leap burger. It came with an iced tea for free.

The quinoa/black bean patty was pretty tasty and the burger was loaded with other vegetables that all worked together. It also had avocado and an onion ring for added crispness. The bun was soft on inside and somewhat toasted on outside — perfect for burgers. The cheese however was inconsistent: the edges were melted but the center was still “raw”, they should’ve blow-torched it. Very enjoyable meal.
